author: sky.cactus
content: Sounds more like an app idea than a standard.  There are a few apps out there that try to do things with uncollateralized debt.  I think Dharma was originally going to try that.

author: dev.incorporated
content: hmm ok. Is there a way I could contribute to this/implement it?

author: sky.cactus
content: I think they have a Discord server and a website, probably best to start there.  They also may know of other uncollateralized loan applications on Ethereum.

author: dev.incorporated
content: <@!301186049323958275> the thing is, that, much like the underlying purpose of ethereum's blockchain itself, I'd like the debt system EIP to support more than just loaning ether

author: sky.cactus
content: Still no need for an EIP.  You need a standard when there is a many to many relationship between components developed/authored by multiple parties.

author: dev.incorporated
content: ok. Yeah sorry I'm new to ethereum so been reading docs

author: dev.incorporated
content: I guess you could just use smart contracts for debt/interest? <@!301186049323958275>
